title: Oxyrhynchus Papyrus 2547
description:
Fragment of a document from Oxyrhynchus, Egypt, including a text of the Hippocratic Oath.

Recto: A business or official document in a fluent cursive hand, almost entirely illegible.

Verso: The Hippocratic Oath. Right hand section of a column of sixteen lines, written in an uncial hand.
isOriginalOf: Colour photograph of a fragment of Hippocratic Oath, held at L5847EA
publicationNote: Transcription and commentary in J W B Barns, The Oxyrhynchus papyri, part 31 (London, 1966), pp. 62-65, with black and white photograph (plate II). Cf. Marie-Hélène Marganne, Inventaire analytique des papyrus grecs de médecine (Geneva, 1981), p. 251, with additional bibliography. Coloured photograph in Vivian Nutton, "Wellcome papiro Oxyrhynchus 2547 e papiro Johnson", Kos 1984, Vol. 1, no. 6, pp. 7-9.
